description: User based conversation flow to help users figure out their premiums

values: Would you like to pay your premium now?
Would you like to explore options that may help you make your payment?
Are you going to have issues paying this increase?
This is why you may have seen your premium increase.
Sorry, I didn't get that.

next_step.dialog_node: How can I help now- after initial task

values: If you want to pay now, you can mail your check into our offices.
Actually, your premium due date of $premiumDueDate is only a few days away. Would you like to pay your bill now?

We will keep the policy in force for the 31 day period following the date your policy goes into default. We call that period the grace period. However, if we have not received the required premiums (specified in your warning notice) by the end of the grace period, the policy will terminate.
Do you think there's any way your can pay your premium?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that.
I'm sorry I didn't get that. Would you like me to change your premium?
Wonderful, I have changed your account.
Sorry, I didn't get that.

next_step.dialog_node: How can I help now- after initial task

values: I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Do you want to pay your premium online now?
Okay, please send your check in the mail. Thanks!

next_step.dialog_node: How can I help now- after initial task

output.display: Great, enter your payment information here.

values: If a Policyowner elects cash surrender in lieu of continuing his premium payments, he will receive the cash value, minus outstanding loans and loan interest.

The application usually provides an opportunity for the applicant to select Premium Loan as the Nonforfeiture Option, stating that they can select it then, or in writing when premium is unpaid before the grace period ends.
When a policy is put on the reduced paid up NFO, the cash value is used to purchase a fully paid-up policy of the same kind with a face amount that is less than the original face.

Extended term insurance comes about when a policy’s cash value is used to purchase term insurance for an amount that is equal to the policy’s original face and will remain in force for the period that the cash value will purchase..
If you choose to renew your Policy at the end of the Premium Guarantee Period, the premiums may increase.
Or $$monthlyPremium monthly.
When the extended term ends, the policy coverage will expire

The application will also state the other NFO options available on the product, and name one (or more, sometimes dependent on ratings) as the automatic non-forfeiture option, which will systematically kick in if an NFO option was not selected at application.
Would you like to learn more about other NFO's?

next_step.dialog_node: How can I help now- after initial task

values: I'm sorry, I didn't get that.

Thanks $ownerName, I'm pulling your account up now.
Thanks $ownerName, I'm pulling your account up now.
Would you like to look at any of these NFO options? I know insurance can be confusing, but I'm here to help you understand a bit better!
Would you like to pay semi annually, quarterly, or monthly?
Would you like to pay quarterly or monthly?

Are you still unable to pay your premium?

To confirm, you would like me to change your premium payments to monthly.

values: How else can I help you?
Anything else I can help you with today?
What else can I help you with?

dialog_nodes.dialog_node: How can I help now- after initial task

values: How can I help you today?
During the Premium Guarantee Period, your premiums are level and guaranteed.
Your premium increased because interest sensitive whole life policies will recalculate the required premium each year.
A policy’s grace period provision states the time that the policy, including all riders, will stay in force after premium is due and unpaid.
A typical grace period is usually 30 to 61 days and varies by state and product.
(4) Or you can do a cash surrender in lieu of continuing your premium payments which will be $$nfoCashSurrender.
Thanks $ownerName!

values: (3) You can put their policy on a reduced paid up NFO for $$nfoReducedPaidUp.
Thanks $ownerName, I'm pulling your account up now.
Are you going to have any issues paying your premium?
A Universal Life policy in which premiums are being deducted from the cash value bucket will lapse if the bucket is depleted and the grace period is over.
By increasing the frequency of your payments, you can reduce your premiums.
Okay, if you need more help, please enter your policy number!
It was great talking to you. If you need more help, put a new policy number in!
I'm sorry, I don't understand. Please ask a question about premiums, grace letters, premium increases, or questions about insurance policies.
Take a look at what I found.
